TO ANYONE WHO USED THIS CRACK OVER THE FLT CRACK AND LOST THEIR SAVE GAME AND ALSO CANNOT SAVE, YOU CAN FIX THIS AND GET YOUR SAVE BACK.

MOUNT BULLETSTORM AND CHOSE TO "REPAIR" IT. AFTER THAT IS DONE, DELETE THE "SKIDROW.DLL" FILE AND THEN RE-DO THE "FLT" CRACK AND YOU'LL BE ABLE TO SAVE AGAIN AS WELL AS CONTINUE PLAYING WHERE YOU LEFT OFF BEFORE...

Step by step this is what I did to get it to work:

Downloaded the Fairlight (FLT) version
Downloaded the SKIDROW crack
Mounted the FLT Bulletstorm iso in Daemon Tools
Installed
Removed the appropriate files as instructed by the SKIDROW crack .nfo file
Copied over the appropriate files as instructed by the SKIDROW crack .nfo file
Installed the Title Update (setup.exe) located on the FLT .iso in the Fairlight Folder
Installed and updated Games for Windows Live
Started the game and I was already logged in under an offline profile and I can now access Chapter Select when I complete Acts of the game.  THANKS SKIDROW.

The FLT crack DOES NOT WORK.  Games for Windows Live will not work with the FLT crack and therefore you will never be able to access Chapter Select, amongst other features.

Applied this crack on FLT's release - installed FLT's title update that they packed in their iso too. Works fine.

Only thing I needed, I found later on, was this:
http://forums.epicgames.com/showthread.php?t=764775

My VCard needed that tweaking, the graphics were off. Not game breaking, but it's much better now.
Sadly, not good enough that I'll start it over. Not so much on account of the graphics, but the rest, namely plot and dialog.
Only upside is I'll easily get it out of my system and clear the space it takes up once I finish it.

To solve:unable to install update until games for windows live has unlocked the game. Please launch the game first.

Step 1) Uninstall the game. Delete the game folder if remaining.
Step 2) Delete Xlive from C:windowssystem32  and c:windowsSysWoW64
Step 3) Install the game. Follow the steps. Now your problem should be solved. 

If this solved your problem. Don't forget to say thanks to fraserbuddy@gmail.com
